thread.title: Like Goldilocks, Labor Data Will Be Too Hot, Too Cold or Just Right for Fed Rate Hike
thread.title_full: Like Goldilocks, Labor Data Will Be Too Hot, Too Cold or Just Right for Fed Rate Hike

title: Like Goldilocks, Labor Data Will Be Too Hot, Too Cold or Just Right for Fed Rate Hike
text:
Credit Cards Auto Like Goldilocks, Labor Data Will Be Too Hot, Too Cold or Just Right for Fed Rate Hike Written by: Jeremy Josse 09/04/15 - 7:37 AM EDT 
NEW YORK ( TheStreet ) -- Today will be a big day for jobs and economic data. The Labor Department's will release its August data at 8.30 a.m. EDT. Economists and other observers see this as one of the most important readings on the health of the U.S. economy. It is about as close as we can get to up-to-date, accurate information on the macro-economic picture. Must Read: 5 Stocks Warren Buffett Is Selling 
But there is something curious about this set of data as it relates to a potential interest rate rise and the performance of equity markets. 
If the data are positive -- if nonfarm payrolls rise significantly -- the Federal Reserve is more likely to increase rates , the thought of which could send markets lower. And if the data are poor, this could spook the market about U.S. economic fundamentals, even as it may not inspire a rate increase. But, if the numbers are within the "Goldilocks" zone (so named for the fairy tale where the hero will only eat porridge that is just the right temperature), the markets should experience a tailwind.
